entries.title: Picking a better Markdown library for bad input
entries.text: Anirvan tried what he thinks is invalid markdown with four different markdown modules, and as a result suggests that Text::Markdown::Discount may be a good choice. One of the problems with markdown is that there are a lot of things not covered by the official spec (which is what prompted Common Mark, amongst other things).

subject: Scratching your itch
header:
Two of this week's entries are about tools that people wrote to scratch their own itch.
That's always been one of the reasons I like Perl: it seems to encourage you to scratch your own itch.
What itch have you scratched recently? Why not tell us about it.
